intro: Zygogynum amplexicaule subsp. amplexicaule, commonly known as the clustered zygogynum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that are often clasping around the stems, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the wet season. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany and horticulture.
